hero.title: Decoding the Immune System with High-Throughput Microarrays.
hero.subtitle: Antibodies are like fingerprints of past infections. Our platform allows you to see exactly which bacterial proteins a patient’s immune system reacts to with high specificity.

surfaceChemistry.title: Advanced Surface Modification
surfaceChemistry.description: We utilize an optimized Aldehyde Silane Coating (APTES-GA) method. This ensures high protein immobilization efficiency and low background noise.

immobilization.title: 1. Immobilization
immobilization.description: ~4,300 E. coli proteins are immobilized on aldehyde-silane coated chips.

blocking.title: 2. Blocking & Wash
blocking.description: Chips are blocked with 3% BSA in PBS to prevent non-specific binding.

incubation.title: 3. Incubation
incubation.description: Incubate with human plasma (1:4000) followed by fluorescent secondary antibodies.

analysis.title: 4. Scanning & Analysis
analysis.description: Scan using LuxScan™ and analyze signal intensity with GenePix Pro.

results.title: High Density. High Sensitivity.
results.description: Experience the power of high-throughput screening with exceptional signal-to-noise ratios.

portfolio.title: Our Chip Portfolio
portfolio.description: Comprehensive proteome coverage for diverse research needs.

human.title: Human Proteome
human.description: High-density human protein coverage for autoantibody screening.

yeast.title: Yeast Proteome
yeast.description: Model organism profiling for eukaryotic cell biology.

ecoli.title: E. coli Proteome
ecoli.description: Complete prokaryotic proteome for bacterial research.

title: Our Technology
description: We combine high-throughput protein microarray wafers with robust assay development and analysis pipelines to profile thousands of proteins in a single experiment.

platforms.title: Proteome chip platforms
platforms.description: Different projects need different levels of coverage. We offer discovery-scale chips that span most of the human proteome, as well as focused panels and truly custom arrays built around your biology.

human.title: Human proteome-wide chip
human.description: A discovery platform covering tens of thousands of human proteins on a single wafer. Ideal for mapping autoantibody landscapes, off-target binding, and early biomarker signatures when you don't yet know which antigens matter.

focused.title: Focused disease panels
focused.description: Curated subsets of proteins tuned to specific disease areas (for example oncology, autoimmunity, or infectious disease). These panels trade breadth for depth and higher throughput in well-defined indication spaces.

custom.title: Custom protein arrays
custom.description: Bring your own targets, antibodies, or candidate panels. We work with you to design custom spotting layouts and controls so you can answer very specific mechanistic or developability questions.

analysis.title: Signal readout & analysis
analysis.description: High-dynamic-range fluorescence imaging, quality control, and downstream analytics convert raw spot intensities into interpretable binding profiles, signatures, and ranked lists you can act on.

platforms.visualNote: The chip visual on our homepage is a stylized view of the same high-density wafers we run in the lab—each spot corresponds to a cloned protein, printed, probed, and quantified.

publications.title: Publications & case studies
publications.description: A selection of work where high-throughput protein microarrays have been central to the experimental design. Replace these placeholders with your actual papers, abstracts, and collaborations.

interactions.title: Multi-Omics Interaction Profiling
interactions.description: Deciphering complex biological networks through simultaneous analysis of Protein-Protein, Protein-Nucleic Acid (DNA/RNA/miRNA), and Protein-Lipid interactions.

immune.title: Immune Response Decoding
immune.description: High-throughput profiling of autoantibodies and immune markers for conditions like SLE, IBD, Kawasaki Disease, and bacterial infections.

smallMolecule.title: Small Molecule & Peptide Screening
smallMolecule.description: Investigating binding specificity for antibiotics, antimicrobial peptides (AMPs), and oxidized peptides.

cellular.title: Cellular Recognition
cellular.description: Analyzing protein interactions with specific cell types including neurons, neutrophils, and epithelial cells.

enzymatic.title: PTM & Enzymatic Assays
enzymatic.description: Monitoring post-translational modifications (PTMs) such as sulfation and kinase activities in real-time.
